question.question-text: Why does the author include the phrase as high as 50 births annually per thousand people in the early nineteenth century in paragraph 1?

answer-list.answer-text: To show that metropolitan areas of the country had higher birthrates than rural areas
To provide statistical evidence of the elevated birthrate in the 1870s
To quantify what had happened with the American population in the previous century
To argue against the belief that the demographics of the country had changed

question.question-text: The author uses the word however in paragraph 1 in order

answer-list.answer-text: to make it clear that an extreme change had taken place
to emphasize how tremendously the population was increasing
to point out an alternate explanation for the change
to indicate a difference of opinion with other demographers

question.question-text: The author includes the word too in paragraph 3

answer-list.answer-text: to indicate that both the birthrate and the deathrate were holding steady
to indicate that both the birthrate and the deathrate were holding steady
to clarify the explanation that population trends before and after 1870 were. similar
to emphasize that paragraph 3 discusses a second factor in the demographic change

question.question-text: Why does the author mention better medical care in paragraph 3?

answer-list.answer-text: It helps to explain why the birthrate is increasing.
It is an example of a factor that contributed to the improved birthrate.
It helps to explain why the deathrate is increasing.
It is an example of a factor that contributed to the improved deathrate.

question.question-text: The author includes the expression Most likely in paragraph 3 to show

answer-list.answer-text: that the data about the average number of deaths was not verified
that doctors and hospitals may not have actually been more available
that other factors may have contributed to the decreasing deathrate
that the deathrate may not have decreased as much as stated
